String.text: There is a newer version available: {0}

Messageboxes.Messagebox:
Do you want to create a backup before applying all changes?
Press "Yes" to create a backup and save. Press "No" to save without backup. Press "Cancel" to abort.
Changes have been applied. You may start the game now.
Please pick your game edition under the General tab.
Please run the game first before using this tool. The game will generate those files on first start-up.
Some values have been reset to default. Only unstable values from previous versions are affected. Don't forget to click 'Apply'.

{0} exception(s) occured while the UI was loaded. This might be caused by corrupted ini files. Some UI elements might not be functioning correctly.
{1}
Please download Archive2 and set the path to decompress *.ba2 archives.
Please set the path to the game (where Fallout76.exe resides).
Wrong Archive2 path. Please select Archive2.exe
Wrong game folder path.
Directory {0} does not exist. Please restart the mod manager and add the mod again.
Directory {0} does not exist. Please restart the mod manager and add the mod again.
Are you sure you want to delete the mod {0}?
Please uncompress the archive and add the mod as a folder.
{0} files are not supported. Please uncompress the archive and add the mod as a folder.
No conflicting files found.
For this action, you have to deploy all mods first.
You haven't deployed the changes you made. Are you sure you want to close the mod manager?
The path {0} does not exist. The mod folder was removed without removing the entry in the manifest.
A mod entry is invalid and was ignored. Error: {0}
The <Mods> tag has invalid attributes. Error: {0}
Are you sure you want to add mods installed outside of the mod manager?
Some mods have the same archive name: "{0}". Conflicting mod name: {1}

Button.text: Fix settings from v1.3.1 and earlier

Label.text: This tool allows you to quickly tweak INI settings.\nTip: Hover over an option, if you're unsure what it does.

Link.text: Get the latest version from NexusMods

Checkbox.Tooltip: Affected values: bShowCompass Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Checkbox.text: Show floating damage numbers in Nuclear Winter
Checkbox.Tooltip: Affected values: bShowDamageNumbers Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Checkbox.text: Show floating damage numbers in Adventure mode
Checkbox.Tooltip: Affected values: bShowDamageNumbers Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bGeneralSubtitles Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bDialogueSubtitles Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Checkbox.text: Show splash screen with news on startup
Checkbox.Tooltip:
If unchecked, the game won't bother you with news on startup.
Affected values: bShowSplash Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

When this option is unchecked, the game will start without displaying the Bethesda logo video.
Affected values: sIntroSequence, uMainMenuDelayBeforeAllowSkip Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

If unchecked, the game won't play background music in the main menu.
Affected values: bPlayMainMenuMusic Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Disable this if you want the game to pause if another window is in front.
Affected values: bAlwaysActive Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Checking this will keep the game's window in foreground. NOTE: This will prevent you from being able to Alt+Tab on single monitors.
Affected values: bTopMostWindow Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Changes the field of view of the 3rd person perspective.
Default: 80 Affected values: fDefaultWorldFOV Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini, Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the field of view of the 1st person perspective.
Default: 80 Affected values: fDefault1stPersonFOV Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini, Fallout76Prefs.ini

Number.Tooltip:
Changes the vertical resolution (height).
Affected values: iSize H

Label.Tooltip:
Changes the display mode.
Fullscreen: Real fullscreen mode
Windowed: Windowed mode with border
Borderless windowed: Make sure, the resolution matches your display's resolution.
Borderless windowed (Fullscreen): Window will be maximized to fit your screen. Looks pixelated (it uses Nearest Neighbor), if the resolution is low.
Affected values: bFull Screen, bBorderless Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Number.Tooltip:
Changes the horizontal resolution (width).
Affected values: iSize W

Label.Tooltip:
Changes the resolution. Setting it to "Custom" will allow you to set your own values.
Affected values: iSize W, iSize H Affected files: Fallout76Prefsini
Set resolution to "Custom" for this option to become available.

Slider.Tooltip:
Sharpens the image.
Default: 0.2 Recommended: 0.4
Affected values: fTAAPostSharpen Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Sharpens the image.
Recommended: 0.2 Default: 0.2
Affected values: fTAAPostOverlay Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Sets the distance grass will begin to fade.
Medium is 4500 High is 5500 Ultra is 7000
Affected values: fGrassStartFadeDistance, fGrassMinStartFadeDistance, fGrassMaxStartFadeDistance Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Checkbox.Tooltip:
Enables/disables the grass ingame.
Affected values: bAllowCreateGrass Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Slider.Tooltip:
Sets the distance actors (=Players, NPCs) will begin to fade.
Affected values: fLODFadeOutMultActors Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Sets the distance items will begin to fade.
Affected values: fLODFadeOutMultItems Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Sets the distance objects will begin to fade.
Affected values: fLODFadeOutMultObjects Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Checkbox.Tooltip:
Unchecking this will disable godrays.
Affected values: bVolumetricLightingEnable Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Blurs shadows. Especially useful, if you set a lower shadow resolution.
Affected values: uiOrthoShadowFilter Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Slider.Tooltip:
Sets the distance that shadows are rendered.
Ultra is 150000 High is 120000 Medium is 90000 Low is 60000
I think, setting it to a low value will disable shadows. Needs more testing.
Affected values: fShadowDistance, fDirShadowDistance Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Resolution of shadows. Higher settings will make shadows more detailed.
Affected values: iShadowMapResolution Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Checkbox.Tooltip:
Enables/disables water displacement (ripples, waves).
Affected values: bUseWaterDisplacements Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Unchecking this will disable ambient occlusion. Ambient occlusion basically adds fake shadows to places light sources can't reach (concave edges).
Affected values: bSAOEnable Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Unchecking this will disable all Depth of Field effects.
Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini Affected values: bDynamicDepthOfField fDOFBlendRatio fDOFMinFocalCoefDist fDOFMaxFocalCoefDist fDOFDynamicFarRange fDOFCenterWeightInt fDOFFarDistance

Blurs moving objects when turning the camera.
Affected values: bMBEnable Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Blurs the screen when the player is hurt (e.g. hit by bullets) or under water. Unchecking this might result in a clear view underwater.
Affected values: bDoRadialBlur, iRadialBlurLevel Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Unchecking this will disable Lens Flare.
Affected values: bLensFlare Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Toggles environmental and clothing wetness occlusion
Affected values: bWetnessOcclusion Affected files: Fallout76.ini

When checked, rain won't be rendered around your character if you're beneath an elevated highway or in a building, and rain drops and splashes won't be rendered on the floor.
Affected values: bRainOcclusion Affected files: Fallout76.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Reduces aliasing of textures when viewed from oblique angles.
Default: 8 Affected values: iMaxAnisotropy Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Checkbox.Tooltip:
Unchecking this will uncap the frame rate.
Enable this if you experience screen tearing. Disable this if you experience input lag.
Please note: Cap the game to 60 FPS manually. (e.g. using NVIDIA's Control Panel)
Default: Enabled Affected values: iPresentInterval Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Reduces aliasing by blurring edges of objects.
TAA - Temporal Anti-Aliasing: Relatively expensive, default FXAA - Fast Approximate Anti-Aliasing: Slightly improves performance, aliasing slightly visible Off - Improves performance, aliasing clearly visible
NOTE: For some reason FXAA doesn't work. The game just disables AA entirely. Atleast for me.
Default: TAA Affected values: sAntiAliasing Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Checkbox.Tooltip:
Uncheck this, if you have a gamepad plugged in, but want to use your keyboard and mouse instead. Leave this checked otherwise.
Affected values: bGamepadEnable Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Enables rumbling (force feedback) of your gamepad.
Affected values: bGamePadRumble Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

If checked, the aim sensitivity will be equal to normal sensitivity. If unchecked (default), the sensitivity will be lower when aiming down iron sights.
Note: This might only work on 16:9 monitors. If it works for you on an other monitor (e.g. 21:9), please let me know.
Affected values: fIronSightsFOVRotateMult Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Slider.Tooltip:
Mouse sensitivity
Affected values: fMouseHeadingSensitivity, fMouseHeadingSensitivityY Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Checkbox.Tooltip:
If checked, the sensitivity for looking up/down and left/right will be equal. If unchecked (default), the sensitivity for looking left/right will likely be higher than up/down.
When checked, your mouse sensitivity might increase.
The sensitivity depends on your display's aspect ratio: For 4:3, the value of X is .028 For 16:9, the value of X is .03738 For 16:10, the value of X is .0336 For 21:9, the value of X is .042
Default: Disabled (.021 for both) Affected values: fMouseHeadingXScale, fMouseHeadingYScale, fPitchSpeedRatio, fIronSightsPitchSpeedRatio Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini

Label.text: These settings affect both the Pipboy and the Quickboy.

Number.Tooltip:
Changes the resolution height of the Pipboy/Quickboy.
Affected values: uPipboyTargetHeight Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Changes the resolution width of the Pipboy/Quickboy.
Affected values: uPipboyTargetWidth Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Radiobutton.Tooltip: Affected values: bQuickboyMode Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini
Affected values: bQuickboyMode Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.Tooltip:
Changes the color of the Pip-Boy which is accessed from the Power Armor.
Affected values: fPAEffectColorR, fPAEffectColorG, fPAEffectColorB Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini
Affected values: fQuickBoyEffectColorR, fQuickBoyEffectColorG, fQuickBoyEffectColorB Affected files: Fallout76Custom.ini
Affected values: fPipboyEffectColorR, fPipboyEffectColorG, fPipboyEffectColorB Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Checkbox.Tooltip:
This option will make all *.ini files read-only immediately. Enable this if your settings get reverted.
Affected files: %UserProfile%\Documents\My Games\Fallout 76\*.ini
If checked, all mods will be removed upon deploy. Useful if you want to play a Nuclear Winter match, hence the name.

Label.text: The use of mods can break your game or get you banned!\nWhen you install mods, you accept full responsibility!
